title: Pareto Chart
label1: Three options - Long format (default) i.e. defects and counts in vertical columns, Wide format i.e. defects as column names and counts as row, and Compute counts from Raw data
selectLongRad: Option 1: Long format - choose defects category and defect counts
selectWideRad: Option 2: Wide format - Columns names will be used as defects category and 1st row (default) will be used as counts
selectRawRad: Option 3: Raw data - compute counts to plot pareto chart
rownumForCounts: Row number (default 1st row) to be used for counts
counts: (Optional) Variable to use as counts to plot
grouping: (Optional) Grouping variable to plot multiple Pareto plots side-by-side
uniformBarOrderChk: Plot bars in the same alphabetical order (across groups). Uncheck for ordering bars based on descending frequency (within each group)
grouping2: (Optional) A grouping variable to plot multiple Pareto side-by-side
ylab2: Y axis label on the right Y axis
RefCumFreqLine: Draw a horizontal reference line for a specified cumulative % (e.g., type 80 for 80%) - leave blank for no line
legends: Show Legends and if so, position of Legends (default is right)
percentStep: Percentage step to be used as tickmarks for the second y-axis on the right side
digits: Number of decimal points for stat table

help.title: Pareto Chart
help.body:
Description
pareto.chart function to create a table of statistics and plot a Pareto chart

For the detail help - use R help(pareto.chart, package = qcc)

To try this, you may use the sample dataset file called defects_frequency_pareto_chart.xlsx. Open the file in the data grid with file open menu
